articles.title: Curve Dental® Launches FLO AI for Smarter Practices
articles.description: Curve Dental®, the leading provider of all-in-one, cloud-based dental practice management software, today announced the release of Curve FLO AI, a deeply embedded suite of artificial intelligence capabilities designed to supercharge productivity and restore the human side of dentistry. Built natively into Curve’s platform, FLO AI eliminates the need for disconnected third-party AI... The post Curve Dental® Launches FLO AI for Smarter Practices first appeared on AI-Tech Park.

articles.content: Curve Dental®, the leading provider of all-in-one, cloud-based dental practice management software, today announced the release of Curve FLO AI, a deeply embedded suite of artificial intelligence capabilities designed to supercharge productivity and restore the human side of dentistry. articles.title: Open Weights and AI for All
articles.description: AI’s next frontier isn’t just about capability—it’s about who gets to use it. Our mission to put AI in the hands of as many people as possible is what drives us. Today’s release of our most capable open-weights models is a major step forward that makes advanced AI more open, flexible, and accessible worldwide.
articles.content: AI’s next frontier isn’t just about capability—it’s about who gets to use it. Our mission to put AI in the hands of as many people as possible is what drives us. Today’s release of our most capable open-weights models is a major step forward that makes advanced AI more open, flexible, and accessible worldwide.

articles.title: Building a Transformer Model for Language Translation
articles.description: This post is divided into six parts; they are: • Why Transformer is Better than Seq2Seq • Data Preparation and Tokenization • Design of a Transformer Model • Building the Transformer Model • Causal Mask and Padding Mask • Training and Evaluation Traditional seq2seq models with recurrent neural networks have two main limitations: • Sequential processing prevents parallelization • Limited ability to capture long-term dependencies since hidden states are overwritten whenever an element is...

articles.title: Black Hat 2025 shows agentic AI moving from theory to practice
articles.description: At Black Hat 2025, agentic artificial intelligence is demonstrating tangible value within cybersecurity, marking a significant evolution from its largely theoretical presence at Black Hat 2024. This advancement represents a shift towards proactive, autonomous systems that can independently investigate, respond to, and predict potential cyberattacks. This transformation fundamentally alters security operations. Dr. Anya Sharma, Chief […]

articles.title: Why Europe could quietly win the humanoid race
articles.description: Elon Musk’s Optimus demo at Tesla’s We Robot event made one thing clear: when it comes to humanoids, the spotlight still belongs to the United States. Then there is Asia — with China’s rapid developments and Japan and South Korea’s deep legacy in robotics. Headlines still gravitate toward billion-dollar budgets, rapid hardware iterations, and slick simulation reels. Behind the noise, though, another development is unfolding in Europe — quieter, but potentially far more consequential. The next...
articles.author: Artem Sokolov
articles.content: Elon Musk’s Optimus demo at Tesla’s We Robot event made one thing clear: when it comes to humanoids, the spotlight still belongs to the United States. Then there is Asia — with China’s rapid developments and Japan and South Korea’s deep legacy in robotics. Headlines still gravitate toward billion-dollar budgets, rapid hardware iterations, and slick simulation reels. articles.title: Learning How to Vote with Principles: Axiomatic Insights Into the Collective Decisions of Neural Networks
articles.description: Can neural networks be applied in voting theory, while satisfying the need for transparency in collective decisions? We propose axiomatic deep voting: a framework to build and evaluate neural networks that aggregate preferences, using the well-established axiomatic method of voting theory. Our findings are: (1) Neural networks, despite being highly accurate, often fail to align with the core axioms of voting rules, revealing a disconnect between mimicking outcomes and reasoning. (2) Training...
articles.author: Levin Hornischer, Zoi Terzopoulou
articles.content: Can neural networks be applied in voting theory, while satisfying the need for transparency in collective decisions? articles.title: Argumentative Reasoning in ASPIC+ under Incomplete Information
articles.description: Reasoning under incomplete information is an important research direction in the study of computational argumentation. Most advances in this direction so far have focused on abstract argumentation frameworks. In particular, development of computational approaches to reasoning under incomplete information in structured formalisms remains to a large extent a challenge. We address this challenge by studying the problems of determining stability and relevance—with the aim of analyzing aspects of...
articles.author: Daphne Odekerken, Tuomo Lehtonen, Johannes P. Wallner, Matti Järvisalo
